did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: E. C. Kelly Cornell and Ithaca printed miscellany, 1890-1960.
did.physdesc: Broadsides, trade cards, pamphlets, brochures, photographs, and other items.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Broadsides, trade cards, pamphlets, brochures, photographs and other items pertaining chiefly to Cornell University and the Tompkins County region.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Broadsides, trade cards, pamphlets, brochures, photographs and other items pertaining chiefly to Cornell University and the Tompkins County region.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: E. C. Kelly Cornell and Ithaca printed miscellany, #1962. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Greeting cards, sheet music, and miscellaneous items.

Items of interest to collectors of antiques, etc.: three volumes on English, French, Italian medieval book binding and illustratioin (printed 1894); miscellaneous book-lists and book catalogues, antique catalogues, notices of sales; all within at least 15 years.

Approximately 200 birthday cards, postcards, Christmas cards, 1900. Cornell and Rensselaer alumni circulars. Approximately 50 travel brochures. Three yearbooks from Oneonta High School - 1896, 1897, 1900.

Personal effects - medical circulars, flower pressings, etc., etc. Religious miscellanea - includes assorted pamphlets and notes, a Spanish/English gospel of St. John (undated), 1930-1931 reports of Methodist Episcopal Missiions, Near East Foundation pamphlet, copy of "Colored Maps of Bible Land" (1898), 2 pamphlets titled "Joyous Living."

Files containing extracts from Munsey's magazine on "The Stage" - 1893-1899 - containing current comments. Also press cuttings on following people, collected over last 30 years: William Seward, Herman Melville, Henry Pringle, Kenneth Roberts, Mark Twain, Richard Mansfield, FW Woolworth, Martin Van Buren, David Warfield, Frank Sullivan, Willard and Michael Straight; also misc. theatre clippings.
